answers.answer: It could be the babies position, or your fluid is low. I wouldn't worry yet tho because the measuring tape is not an accurate way to check for gestational age. The ultrasound is the best way ton check. Good luck and let us know how it goes!
I hope everything is okay :/ and its just the baby position. I'm gonna be worried sick all weekend tho
I wouldn't worry mama, with the measuring tape it's common to measure 2 weeks off in either direction. Sleep easy this weekend and just wait till your ultrasound. :)

I was measuring small 4 weeks behind and ended up having low fluid levels and a small baby and needed scans every week! Although my daughter was born at 38 weeks weighing 6lb11oz when my scan that same week estimated her at 5lb and when my water broke it was a never ending amount and couldn't have possibly been low fluid around her!!

I have type 2 diabetes and my daughter was born at 36+5 weighing 4 lbs 11 ozs. The size honestly depends on how well your sugars are controlled. If they are constantly high then yes you have a higher chance of having a big baby if they are under control then you have a better chance of a normal size baby. How this helps some.

Im supposed to be 9 weeks but my ultrasound showed 5 weeks 4 days but im having twins I also have type two diabetes so idk maybe I was wrong on dates . And I just started monitoring my glucose n it been really high im supposed to go monday to see what my doctor is going to prescribe. Most likely insulin . But hang in their just relax your self I find my self taking deep breath so I can calm my nervs too hopefully everythin turns out good for you

question: I have gestational diabetes since 27 weeks I've been measuring small and every time its been two weeks behind so my midwife ordered a ultrasound for Monday. But what would cause this? Usually with diabetes you have a bigger baby and mine is small? I'm a very small person before pregnancy I was 105 soaking wet and that was at my heaviest. I had a growth and dating scan at 12 weeks and at 19 weeks I had my anatomy scan and everything was normal. Has anyone went through this? Is there something wrong with my baby?
title: measuring small
